page.title: 07Government in Aboyne
page.content: {Government:} In Aboyne we have a regional councillor, Mr Humphrey who sits on the Grampian Regional{Council}and a District councillor Mr Grant who sits on the Kincardine and Deeside District Council. Each is elected for 4 years. The regional elections will take place next in 1986 and the District {elections}in 1988. The main areas dealt with by the regional council are education, public transport, roads and the police. The District Council deals mostly with local planning applications, libraries, housing and refuse collection. {Local opinion}is discussed in the mid_Deeside community Council. Aboyne holds nine out of the total 20 seats and through this organisation opinion is expressed to the District Council on local issues such as recreational facilities.
